sn5.9:1.2: Then the nun Selā robed up in the morning …
sn5.9:1.3: and sat at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
sn5.9:1.4: Then Māra the Wicked, wanting to make the nun Selā feel fear, terror, and goosebumps …
sn5.9:3.2: “Who’s speaking this verse, a human or a non-human?”
sn5.9:3.4: “This is Māra the Wicked, wanting to make me feel fear, terror, and goosebumps, wanting to make me fall away from immersion!”
sn5.9:3.5: Then Selā, knowing that this was Māra the Wicked, replied to him in verse:
sn5.9:4.2: nor is this gloom made by another.
sn5.9:4.3: It comes to be because of a cause,
sn5.9:4.4: and ceases when the cause breaks up.
sn5.9:5.1: It’s like a seed that’s sown
sn5.9:5.3: relying on both the soil’s nutrients
sn5.9:6.1: In the same way the aggregates and elements
sn5.9:6.3: come to be because of a cause,
sn5.9:6.4: and cease when the cause breaks up.”
sn5.9:7.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The nun Selā knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
